metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11421 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: gnome-exe-thumbnailer before 0.9.5 is prone to a VBScript Injection when generating thumbnails for MSI files, aka the "Bad Taste" issue. There is a local attack if the victim uses the GNOME Files file manager, and navigates to a directory containing a .msi file with VBScript code in its filename.

criterions.comment: gnome-exe-thumbnailer: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
